Articles.Content:
Hello, as I've too many crash since KSP 1.1, I've made a rewrite of QuickStart to return where I was before the crash, I've tried to make it works with all other mods, for this I've push it in a beta update, Thanks to post your return with all your others mods

QuickStart

Download:

Github

 

Changelog - v2.00 beta 1 - 2016.05.25

  • New: Re-added the start to VAB/SPH/TS/LastVessel,
  • New: Added a new setting parameter to wait after the loading of a scene (500ms by default),
  • New: Added a button to change the savegame to load,
  • New: Added a backup of the last scene used (if you crash in VAB, QuickStart will load the VAB),
  • New: Added an automatic backup of your ship in the editor (each 30 seconds),
  • New: Added the loading of the auto saved ship in the editor,
  • New: Added an automatic pause in flight when you start to last vessel,
  • Fix: Rewrite the LastVessel functions, it will now save the real last vessel used,
  • Fix: Enhanced the settings functions,
  • Fix: Corrected the KSC lock camera on focus,
  • Fix: Corrected the compatibility with others mods on loading the mainmenu,
  • Fix: Corrected the compatibility with others mods on loading the spacecenter,
  • Fix: Corrected UI positions,
  • Fix: Rewrite many others functions,
  • Compiled against KSP 1.1.2.1260
Edited May 26, 2016 by Malah

Thanks for the update, it solved my problem with the icon of infernal robotics not working.

Very appreciated

QuickStart:

How can this be? I just recognized a new bug, I'm not sure where it came from, the

... yes ...

IR buttons and UI windows are not working ...

Now I come over here, a few hours after I installed QuickStart 2.00 and read this:

Quote

Thanks for the update, it solved my problem with the icon of infernal robotics not working.

Huh?

So for the one it's a fix, for the other it's a new bug?

Check this about my issue:

 

Edited May 25, 2016 by Gordon Dry

On QuickStart, I've found a little bug which block the go to lastvessel, it will be corrected soon (the time to let us found others bugs).

 

1 hour ago, Gordon Dry said:

QuickStart:

How can this be? I just recognized a new bug, I'm not sure where it came from, the

... yes ...

IR buttons and UI windows are not working ...

Now I come over here, a few hours after I installed QuickStart 2.00 and read this:

Huh?

So for the one it's a fix, for the other it's a new bug?

Check this about my issue:

 

I don't see these errors ... QuickStart + IR: I have IR applauncher button and IR UI windows.

Edited May 26, 2016 by Malah

Infernals works for me without a problem now, both in stock toolbar and blizzy.

Works in editor and flight.

Using IR 2.0.4, maybe you have another version?

I auto load always in space center, the auto load of last vessel always did weird thins in older versions so I didn't even tried.
IR 2.0.4, sequencer, legacy, rework - all in.

I have QuickMute installed, and it doesn't seem to mute the startup sound some engines have (e.g. those from KW rocketry) . Everything else is muted, so I'm sure it isn't totally broken. Is there a quick fix for this?

16 hours ago, awang said:

I have QuickMute installed, and it doesn't seem to mute the startup sound some engines have (e.g. those from KW rocketry) . Everything else is muted, so I'm sure it isn't totally broken. Is there a quick fix for this?

I thought this bug was corrected with Unity 5 ... I work on it thanks.
As it has been about a month since the last mentioning of QuickGoTo, may I as for any possible updates?

I simply cannot believe that in 1.1, with ALL the time Squad had to implement this, that they still have that retarded game exit process. I can't think of any other game that makes you go through so many steps to quit to desktop. And on top of that, you have to wait for the pointless ANIMATED menus to slide around the screen before you can click quit again.

 

I truly hope QuickExit comes soon!

Found something interesting with QuickMute.  If I toggle QuickMute, I get some interesting construction sounds in the background when I'm in the VAB.  While I don't mind them per-se, I can't control them with the normal volume sliders.  When I uninstall QuickMute, the sounds go away.  Anyone else experience the same thing?

On 13/06/2016 at 9:51 PM, DSD54 said:

As it has been about a month since the last mentioning of QuickGoTo, may I as for any possible updates?

 

 

On 14/06/2016 at 3:37 AM, Recon777 said:

I simply cannot believe that in 1.1, with ALL the time Squad had to implement this, that they still have that retarded game exit process. I can't think of any other game that makes you go through so many steps to quit to desktop. And on top of that, you have to wait for the pointless ANIMATED menus to slide around the screen before you can click quit again.

 

I truly hope QuickExit comes soon!

QuickGoTo, QuickExit and QuickRevert will have an update at the release of KSP 1.1.3
I've made a rework on QuickExit and QuickRevert because they were my first mods and they had many wrong functions
I have planned to re-added GUI on QuickBrake (and an option to unbrake at launch)
 

On 18/06/2016 at 7:24 PM, rsparkyc said:

Found something interesting with QuickMute.  If I toggle QuickMute, I get some interesting construction sounds in the background when I'm in the VAB.  While I don't mind them per-se, I can't control them with the normal volume sliders.  When I uninstall QuickMute, the sounds go away.  Anyone else experience the same thing?

I think it's the vehicle on the VAB? I will re-added my old settings mute (which I thought it was useless with Unity 5 ...).

Edited June 20, 2016 by Malah

Hello, it's time to an update

I've added QuickFineControl and QuickCursorHider on my quick's mods

 

QuickCursorHider

 

What is it?

QuickCursorHider is a plugin which hide the cursor when you push on F2.

Download:

SpaceDock
Github


More Informations:

Spoiler

Licence information:

GPL v3

Source code:

github

How to install it?

Unzip all files. Put the QuickCursorHider folder in your KSP/GameData folder.

How to update it?

Unzip all files. Merge the new QuickCursorHider folder with the old folder which is in your KSP/GameData folder.

How to uninstall it?

Delete the QuickCursorHider folder in your KSP/GameData folder.

Changelog on GITHUB

Thanks!

  • to DuoDex to have requested this mod,
  • to all other mod developers which make this game really huge,
  • and to Squad for this awesome game.

Links

  • http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/85834-1
  • http://spacedock.info/mod/783/QuickCursorHider
  • https://github.com/malahx/QuickCursorHider

 

QuickFineControl

 

What is it?

QuickFineControl is a plugin which adds the possibility to toggle the precision control at the load of a vessel.

Download:

SpaceDock
Github


More Informations:

Spoiler

Licence information:

GPL v3

Source code:

github

How to install it?

Unzip all files. Put the QuickFineControl folder in your KSP/GameData folder.

How to update it?

Unzip all files. Merge the new QuickFineControl folder with the old folder which is in your KSP/GameData folder.

How to uninstall it?

Delete the QuickFineControl folder in your KSP/GameData folder.

Changelog on GITHUB

 

Thanks!

  • to Red Iron Crown to have requested this mod,
  • to all other mod developers which make this game really huge,
  • and to Squad for this awesome game.

Links

  • http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/85834-1
  • http://spacedock.info/mod/784/QuickFineControl
  • https://github.com/malahx/QuickFineControl

 

QuickSearch

 

Download:

SpaceDock
Github

Changelog - v3.02 - 2016.06.23

  • Fix: Compiled against KSP 1.1.3.1289

QuickGoTo

Download:

SpaceDock
Github

Changelog - v1.22 - 2016.06.23

  • Fix: Corrected the building button,
  • Fix: Enhanced the settings functions,
  • Compiled against KSP 1.1.3.1289

 

QuickExit

Download:

SpaceDock
Github

Changelog - v2.00 - 2016.06.22

  • New: Added an auto save the current ship on exit from the editor.
  • Fix: Re-write some functions,
  • Fix: Enhanced the settings functions,
  • Compiled against KSP 1.1.3.1289

QuickBrake

Download:

SpaceDock
Github

Changelog - v1.13 - 2016.06.23

  • New: Re-Added all GUI and support of Blizzy/Stock toolbars,
  • New: Added unbrake at launch ,
  • Fix: Enhanced the settings functions,
  • Compiled against KSP 1.1.3.1289

QuickStart

Download:

SpaceDock
Github

Changelog - v2.00 - 2016.06.23

  • New: Added support of the activeVessel variable of the FLIGHTSTATE,
  • Fix: Corrected the name of the ScenarioModule to load,
  • Fix: Corrected the last vessel detection,
  • Fix: Hid all QuickStart text if QuickStart is disabled on the loading screen,
  • Fix: Enhanced the wait after the loading of a scene for player who has too many mods,
  • Fix: Corrected UI positions (again).
  • Compiled against KSP 1.1.3.1289

 

QuickMute

Download:

SpaceDock
Github

Changelog - v1.09 - 2016.06.23

  • Fix: (again) Corrected the mute function for FX sounds (return with a GameSettings mute ...),
  • Fix: Enhanced the settings functions,
  • Compiled against KSP 1.1.3.1289
Edited June 23, 2016 by Malah
desc QuickCursorHider

YES!! Thank you for Quick GoTo & QuickExit...
Those are the two I've found it hardest to do without...

As always, THANK YOU, Malah, for your efforts with ALL these awesome mods...
Thank you Malah. Sometimes it's the smallest mods that make the biggest difference.
I recently used QuickStart to jump straight to a vessel, and once I had control I found that all my contract progression had been reset. I'm on KSP 1.1.3 and my version of QuickStart is up to date.

@Malah Ive been getting some exceptions from QuickStart, and warnings from QuickMute, ever since I installed the latest versions... Doesnt seem to affect gameplay, and they still seem to function... Just trying to clean things up, as I'm testing and dev'ing a couple mods, so trying to clean things up to make troubleshooting THOSE mods a bit easier...

QuickStart v2.0.0.0, and QuickMute v1.0.8.0 (I'm also on KSP 1.1.3). This is with ONLY ExceptionDetector, and several Quick-mods installed...

Anyway, here's the exceptions I'm getting from the KSP.log and ExceptionDetector:

  

8.323752: InvalidOperationException: Operation is not valid due to the current state of the object

          at QuickStart.QSaveGame.get_LastUsed ()

I recently used QuickStart to jump straight to a vessel, and once I had control I found that all my contract progression had been reset. I'm on KSP 1.1.3 and my version of QuickStart is up to date.

No log no help.

It seems as if the Blizzy toolbar option for Quick Go To isn't working properly for me

no log no help

Hello Malah,

i've downloaded your fine QuickIVA mod recently and I really appreciate it. It's a must have for a hardcore experience!

The reason why i write you is that i'm on 1.1.3. and got some strange behaviour. I've tested it with and without other mods.

1. A minor toolbar (stock and blizzy) bug
- which doesn't let you change the settings of the settings file
- settings and its menu are still shown correctly
- you can manually edit settings file
 

2. Major: No control of your vessel
- it seems you cant steer the vessels anymore (keys: wasd + qe)
- sas/rcs can still be activated though

This is what i found in the Log so far:

120.7695: MissingMethodException: Method not found: 'FlightDriver.SetPause'.
          at QuickIVA.QGUI.SettingsSwitch ()
          at QuickIVA.QGUI.Settings ()
          at QuickIVA.QBlizzyToolbar.OnClick ()
          at QuickIVA.QBlizzyToolbar.<Init>m__0 (QuickIVA.ClickEvent e)
          at QuickIVA.Button.clicked (System.Object realEvent)
          at Toolbar.Command.click ()
          at UnityEngine.Debug:LogException(Exception)
          at Toolbar.Log:log(LogLevel, Exception, String, Object[])
          at Toolbar.Log:error(Exception, String, Object[])
          at Toolbar.Command:click()
          at Toolbar.Button:click()
          at Toolbar.Button:drawInToolbar(Rect, Boolean)
          at Toolbar.Toolbar:drawButtons()
          at Toolbar.Toolbar:draw()
          at Toolbar.ToolbarManager:OnGUI()

127.1562: MissingMethodException: Method not found: 'FlightDriver.SetPause'.
          at QuickIVA.QGUI.SettingsSwitch ()
          at QuickIVA.QGUI.Settings ()
          at QuickIVA.QGUI.DrawSettings (Int32 id)
          at UnityEngine.GUILayout+LayoutedWindow.DoWindow (Int32 windowID)
          at UnityEngine.GUI.CallWindowDelegate (UnityEngine.WindowFunction func, Int32 id, UnityEngine.GUISkin _skin, Int32 forceRect, Single width, Single height, UnityEngine.GUIStyle style)

I already read that you plan to update this plugin. I just wanted to contribute my info as i didn't find anything about quickiva errors on 1.1.3 so far in this topic.


Apart from begging for an update , i wanted to ask if there is a chance for an "1st person eva view with forcing" option to be added. Well, "1st person eva view" isn't stock so i wont put to much hope in it. But as all the known mods which had such features are outdated and not working anymore it would close a real gap and would make your mod even more a must have!

 

Thank you for all your time you spend on this project already.
Wish you all the best,

Sincerely LtMtz
